Action.author: mgbailey
Action.body: These ledger transactions also show something erroneous that I thought was the subject of another ticket, but which I cannot locate. It is that the steward wrote a NYM with DID and verkey. He then attempted twice more to write it, with the same DID but a different verkey. The message in the CLI showed that it was rejected, but an entry wound up in the ledger anyway. This is where transactions 35 & 36 came from.

Action.author: krw910
Action.body: ~ozheregelya We need you to try and duplicate this issue using version 1.1.43 of Stable. The main issue in this ticket is that the pool wrote a transaction days later which is a duplicate of earlier transactions. If you can duplicate it with 1.1.43 try with 1.2.50.

Action.author: ozheregelya
Action.body: ~krw910 , description looks like INDY-1047. I'll compare logs and try to reproduce this problem on old stable tomorrow.

Action.author: ozheregelya
Action.body: If nobody objects, I'll move it to 'won't fix'.
